title: Recruiter Job at ETC Workforce Services Limited
content:
ETC Workforce Services Limited is a leading workforce management, outsourcing and advisory organization, empowering businesses to focus on their core competencies while we handle the complexities of HR, staffing, and operational support.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Recruiter

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid)
Industry: We do not mind, but just know the rudiments of recruitment

About the Role
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a proactive and resourceful Recruiter to join our team and help us identify, attract, and hire top talent across various functions.
	As a Recruiter, you will play a hands-on role in managing the full recruitment cycle—from sourcing candidates to facilitating interviews and closing offers—while ensuring a smooth and engaging experience for all stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities


	Work closely with hiring managers to understand job requirements and team dynamics.
	Create and post job descriptions on appropriate platforms to attract qualified candidates.
	Source, screen, and shortlist candidates through job boards, social media, databases, and networking.
	Conduct initial interviews and coordinate next steps with hiring teams.
	Schedule interviews, gather feedback, and facilitate timely decision-making.
	Manage candidate communication to ensure a positive experience throughout the recruitment process.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date candidate records using the Applicant Tracking System (ATS).
	Support employer branding initiatives and talent outreach campaigns.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business, or a related field.
	2 - 4 years of proven experience in recruitment or talent sourcing.
	Strong knowledge of recruitment techniques and platforms (e.g., LinkedIn, Indeed, ATS).
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to manage multiple roles and prioritize tasks effectively.
	High level of professionalism, integrity, and attention to detail.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Experience recruiting for multiple departments or industries.
	Familiarity with HR software and recruitment tools.
	Certification in HR or Recruiting (e.g., SHRM-CP, PHR) is a plus.


What We Offer


	A collaborative and supportive work environment.
	Opportunities for career growth and development.
	Flexible work options.
	Competitive salary and benefits.


Note: Ready to help us build a strong and diverse team?

title: Restaurant Accountant Job at Jibs-Ray Nigeria Limited
content:
Jibs-Ray Nigeria Limited is a recruitment and consulting company established in 2018 to proffer manpower solutions to its clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Accountant
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Accountant duty is to keep and interpret the outlet’s financial records and manages all financial transactions of the outlet, from fixed payments and variable expenses to bank deposits through various channels.


Roles & Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Keep records and manage daily sales after checking all related source documents.
	Manage petty cash disbursement, recording and documentation.
	Maintain all receivables and payables accounts of the outlet.
	Reconciliation of current accounts with head office and other outlets.
	Reviewing of all postings: general ledger, fixed assets, inventory, receivable and payable.
	Periodic reporting of outlet financial performance.
	Update records using the accounting system, carry out regular database back up and system maintenance.
	Handle monthly, quarterly and annual closings.
	Compute taxes, prepare tax returns comply with financial policies and regulations.


Requirements


	HND / B.Sc in Accounting, Finance or any relevant Degree.
	2 - 5 years of work experience as an Accountant.
	Strong attention to detail and good analytical skills.
	Good knowledge of SAGE application.


Salary
N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application / CV to: jibs.ray@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Internal Control Officer Job at Prestige Superstores
content:
Prestige Superstores is an evolving, multi-location grocery headquartered in Iyana-Ipaja, Lagos, Nigeria. We are the aqueduct to personal and basic household needs. We maintain a conducive shopping atmosphere, pleasant shopping experience, and we pay attention to customers’ needs and feedbacks. PRESTIGE was founded in July 2019; and has built a reputation as a world-class grocery that consistently leaves shoppers with a smile. Our operations spans across three (3) outlets in the populated areas of Lagos metropolis and one (1) outlet in Ogun State. At PRESTIGE, we see our shoppers as part of our family, and we place premium on satisfactory customer experience daily; this has earned us customer loyalty.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Control Officer
Job Location: Iyana Ipaja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Internal Control Officer to join our team at our Alimosho (Iyana Ipaja) branch.
	This role is critical to ensuring compliance, minimizing risk, and safeguarding the company’s assets through effective internal control processes.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of internal controls across store operations.
	Conduct regular audits of processes including inventory, cash handling, bakery, and point-of-sale systems.
	Investigate irregularities or suspected integrity issue and report findings to management.
	Support in the implementation of risk management strategies.
	Identify weaknesses or gaps in procedures and recommend improvements.
	Work with HR/Risk & Control to ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.
	Prepare accurate and timely internal control reports.


Requirements


	B.Sc./HND
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in internal control, or compliance (retail experience is an added advantage).
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles and internal control systems.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially Excel.
	Attention to detail, integrity, and strong analytical skills.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to: feedback.prestigesuperstores@gmail.com using “Internal Control Officer – Alimosho” as the subject of the email.
